technicalSeo.title: TECHNICAL SEO
technicalSeo.desc: Deep technical audits covering crawlability, indexation, site architecture, Core Web Vitals, and structured data. We fix what search engines struggle to read so your pages rank where they belong.
technicalSeo.longDesc:
Technical SEO is the invisible infrastructure that determines whether search engines can effectively discover, crawl, render, and index your content. Without a solid technical foundation, even the most brilliant content will remain buried in search results. Our technical SEO service addresses every layer of your site architecture, from server response codes and XML sitemaps to JavaScript rendering and Core Web Vitals, ensuring Google and Bing can process your pages efficiently.

We begin with a comprehensive crawl analysis using Screaming Frog, Sitebulb, and Google Search Console. We map your entire site architecture, identify orphan pages, detect redirect chains, flag duplicate content via canonical audits, and evaluate your internal linking topology. Every robots.txt directive and meta robots tag is reviewed to ensure no critical pages are accidentally blocked from indexation. We also audit your XML sitemaps for completeness, proper lastmod dates, and submission status.

Core Web Vitals have been a confirmed Google ranking signal since the Page Experience update. We measure and optimise Largest Contentful Paint, First Input Delay (now Interaction to Next Paint), and Cumulative Layout Shift using real-user data from CrUX and lab data from Lighthouse. This involves image optimisation, font loading strategies, critical CSS extraction, JavaScript defer and async patterns, and layout stability fixes. For European sites, we also evaluate CDN configuration and server-side rendering performance across target geographies.

Structured data is where technical SEO meets visibility. We implement and validate JSON-LD schemas including Organization, LocalBusiness, FAQPage, HowTo, BreadcrumbList, Product, and Review markup. Proper structured data directly enables rich results in Google Search, increasing click-through rates by 20-30%. Every implementation is tested against Google Rich Results Test and Schema.org validator before deployment.

localSeo.title: LOCAL SEO
localSeo.desc: Dominate local search results across European cities with Google Business Profile optimisation, local citations, review management, and geo-targeted schema markup that drives foot traffic and enquiries.
localSeo.longDesc:
Local SEO is the most cost-effective channel for businesses serving specific geographic areas. When someone searches for services near me or in a specific European city, your business needs to appear in the Local Pack, Google Maps, and organic results. Our local SEO service is specifically tailored for European markets, where multi-country and multi-language considerations add layers of complexity that most agencies overlook.

Google Business Profile is the cornerstone of local visibility. We fully optimise your GBP listing with accurate NAP data (Name, Address, Phone), compelling business descriptions in each target language, proper category selection from Google's taxonomy, high-quality photos with geo-tagged EXIF data, and regular Google Posts to signal activity. We configure service areas, business hours, and attributes to match local search behaviour in each target market, whether that's Paris, London, Brussels, or Amsterdam.

Local citations and directory consistency are critical ranking factors. We audit and correct your business information across major European directories including PagesJaunes, Yelp Europe, Yell, Gouden Gids, and industry-specific platforms. NAP consistency across every listing signals trust to Google's local algorithm. We also build structured local citations with proper schema markup and manage review generation campaigns that build social proof while staying compliant with Google's review policies.

For multi-location European businesses, we implement location-specific landing pages with unique, locally relevant content, embedded Google Maps, LocalBusiness schema markup, and geo-targeted internal linking. Each city page targets location-specific long-tail keywords identified through tools like Google Keyword Planner, SEMrush, and Ahrefs with regional filters. We track local rankings across each target city using geo-specific rank tracking to measure real visibility where your customers search.

intlSeo.title: INTERNATIONAL SEO
intlSeo.desc: Expand across European markets with proper hreflang implementation, multi-market keyword strategy, localised content, and country-specific domain architecture that ranks in every target country.
intlSeo.longDesc:
Selling across borders requires more than translating your website. International SEO ensures that the right version of your content appears to the right audience in the right country. A French user in Paris should see your French pages, while a Dutch user in Amsterdam sees the Dutch version, and Google should understand this intent clearly. Mishandled international SEO leads to cannibalisation, wasted crawl budget, and rankings that favour the wrong market.

Hreflang implementation is the technical backbone of international SEO, and it is notoriously error-prone. We implement hreflang annotations via HTML link elements, HTTP headers, or XML sitemaps depending on your architecture. Every tag is validated for return tag consistency, proper ISO 639-1 language codes, and ISO 3166-1 country codes. We also configure x-default tags for fallback handling and audit for common issues like self-referencing errors and non-reciprocal hreflang links that Google has confirmed will cause tags to be ignored entirely.

Keyword strategy must be localised, not translated. The French term for website design is not a direct translation of the English phrase, and search volumes and intent differ dramatically across markets. We conduct native-level keyword research for each target language and country using local SERP analysis, regional search volume data, and competitor keyword mapping. This informs content creation that resonates with local audiences and matches their actual search behaviour, covering British English versus American English nuances, formal versus informal German registers, and Belgian French versus Metropolitan French vocabulary.

Domain architecture decisions have lasting SEO impact. We advise on ccTLDs versus subdirectories versus subdomains based on your budget, brand strategy, and target markets. For most European businesses, we recommend subdirectories (example.com/fr/, example.com/de/) because they consolidate domain authority while providing clear geo-language signals. We configure Google Search Console international targeting, submit localised sitemaps per language, and ensure proper geotargeting signals throughout your technical stack.

contentSeo.title: CONTENT SEO
contentSeo.desc: Data-driven content strategy with keyword research, topic clustering, editorial calendars, and internal linking architecture that builds topical authority and drives sustained organic growth.
contentSeo.longDesc:
Content SEO bridges the gap between what your audience searches for and what your website offers. Without strategic content, your site is a brochure. With it, you become a magnet for qualified organic traffic that compounds over time. Our content SEO service combines rigorous keyword research with topic cluster architecture, ensuring every piece of content serves a clear purpose in your organic growth strategy.

We start with comprehensive keyword research using Ahrefs, SEMrush, and Google Search Console data to identify high-intent keywords that align with your business objectives. We analyse search volume, keyword difficulty, SERP features, and searcher intent to prioritise opportunities. Keywords are grouped into topic clusters with pillar pages and supporting content mapped around core themes. This hub-and-spoke model builds topical authority, which Google's Helpful Content system increasingly rewards with higher rankings.

Content creation follows E-E-A-T principles: Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness. Every piece we produce includes original insights, expert quotes, data citations, and clear author attribution. We write for humans first but optimise for search engines with proper heading hierarchy, semantic keyword placement, internal linking, and featured snippet targeting. Content formats include long-form guides, comparison articles, how-to tutorials, and data-driven studies, each chosen based on what the SERP rewards for that query.

Internal linking is the most underutilised lever in content SEO. We design linking architectures that distribute PageRank efficiently from high-authority pages to newer content, create clear topical relationships between related articles, and guide users through logical content journeys. Combined with regular content audits that identify decay, consolidation opportunities, and refresh candidates, this approach ensures your content library grows more powerful over time rather than accumulating dead weight.

linkBuilding.title: LINK BUILDING
linkBuilding.desc: White-hat link acquisition through digital PR, guest posting, HARO outreach, and broken link building. Quality backlinks from European domains that build lasting domain authority.
linkBuilding.longDesc:
Backlinks remain one of Google's strongest ranking signals. But the days of quantity over quality are long gone. Google's SpamBrain algorithm, updated multiple times since 2022, aggressively devalues manipulative link patterns. Our link building service focuses exclusively on earning genuine editorial links from relevant, authoritative European websites through methods that align with Google's guidelines and deliver lasting SEO value.

Digital PR is our primary link acquisition channel. We create newsworthy content assets including original research, data studies, industry surveys, and expert commentary that European journalists and bloggers genuinely want to reference. We pitch these assets to targeted media lists across your markets, covering UK publications, French press, Dutch media, and German industry outlets. Every link earned comes from real editorial decisions, not paid placements, ensuring they withstand any future algorithm update.

Guest posting on relevant industry publications builds both links and brand authority. We identify authoritative blogs and online magazines in your sector across European markets, pitch topic ideas that provide genuine value to their audience, and produce high-quality articles with natural contextual links back to your site. We also leverage HARO (Help a Reporter Out) and its European equivalents to secure expert quote links in major publications. These journalist-sourced links carry exceptional trust signals.

Broken link building and link reclamation round out our strategy. We scan competitor backlink profiles using Ahrefs and Majestic to identify linking pages where resources have moved or disappeared. We then create superior replacement content and reach out to webmasters with a genuine value proposition: replace their broken outbound link with a working link to your relevant, high-quality resource. We also reclaim unlinked brand mentions across the web, converting existing references to your brand into valuable backlinks.

seoConsulting.title: SEO CONSULTING
seoConsulting.desc: Expert SEO audits, strategy sessions, and hands-on training for in-house teams. Get clear direction from specialists who have optimised sites across six European markets.
seoConsulting.longDesc:
Not every business needs a full-service SEO agency. Some have capable in-house teams that need expert guidance, a second opinion on their strategy, or training to level up their skills. Our SEO consulting service provides exactly that: direct access to senior SEO specialists who have delivered results across France, UK, Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, and beyond, without the overhead of a retainer engagement.

Our consulting begins with a deep-dive SEO audit that goes far beyond automated tool reports. We manually review your site architecture, content quality, technical implementation, backlink profile, and competitive positioning. The deliverable is not a generic checklist but a prioritised, actionable strategy document with specific recommendations ranked by impact and effort. We explain not just what to fix but why it matters, connecting every recommendation to measurable business outcomes like traffic, leads, or revenue.

Strategy sessions are structured around your specific challenges. Whether you need guidance on international expansion, recovering from a Google algorithm penalty, planning a site migration without losing rankings, or evaluating your content strategy against competitors, we bring data-driven insights and proven frameworks. Sessions can be one-off or recurring, and we provide detailed documentation of every recommendation so your team can execute with confidence.

For teams looking to build long-term SEO capability, we offer hands-on training workshops covering technical SEO fundamentals, content optimisation workflows, Google Search Console mastery, and analytics interpretation. Training is customised to your team's skill level and your specific CMS or tech stack. We also provide ongoing advisory retainers where your team can access expert guidance via scheduled calls and async communication, ensuring they stay on track between training sessions.

googleAds.title: GOOGLE ADS MANAGEMENT
googleAds.desc: Performance-driven Google Ads campaigns across Search, Display, Shopping, and YouTube. Multilingual ad copy, European market targeting, and rigorous ROAS optimisation for every euro spent.
googleAds.longDesc:
Google Ads delivers immediate visibility while SEO builds long-term. But managing campaigns across multiple European markets and languages is complex. Keyword costs, competition levels, and user behaviour differ dramatically between London, Paris, Amsterdam, and Berlin. Our Google Ads management service handles this complexity, running profitable campaigns in English, French, Dutch, and German with market-specific strategies that maximise return on ad spend.

We manage all Google Ads campaign types: Search campaigns for high-intent keywords, Display campaigns for brand awareness and remarketing, Shopping campaigns for e-commerce products, and YouTube campaigns for video-driven engagement. Each campaign type requires a different strategy. Search campaigns need tight keyword match types and negative keyword management. Display requires careful audience targeting and frequency capping. Shopping demands optimised product feeds with accurate attributes. We handle all of this.

Ad copy localisation goes far beyond translation. We write native-level ad copy for each market that respects cultural nuances, uses locally relevant calls to action, and includes market-specific trust signals. A French audience responds to different messaging than a British or Dutch audience. We A/B test ad variations per market, optimise headlines and descriptions based on quality score data, and leverage responsive search ads with market-specific asset combinations. Landing pages are aligned with ad messaging to maintain quality score and conversion rates.

Budget optimisation is rigorous and data-driven. We implement proper conversion tracking via Google Tag Manager with Consent Mode v2 for GDPR compliance, ensuring accurate attribution across all markets. Bid strategies are tailored to campaign maturity: manual CPC during learning phases, transitioning to target CPA or target ROAS as conversion data accumulates. We provide transparent weekly reports showing spend, impressions, clicks, conversions, and cost per acquisition by campaign and market, with clear recommendations for budget reallocation.

analyticsSetup.title: ANALYTICS SETUP
analyticsSetup.desc: Professional GA4 configuration, Google Tag Manager implementation, conversion tracking, custom dashboards, and data layer architecture. GDPR-compliant measurement that drives informed decisions.
analyticsSetup.longDesc:
You cannot improve what you do not measure. Yet most European businesses are running outdated analytics setups, misconfigured GA4 properties, or missing critical conversion tracking entirely. Our analytics setup service implements a measurement infrastructure that gives you clear, accurate, and actionable data while remaining fully compliant with GDPR and the EU ePrivacy Directive.

Google Analytics 4 represents a fundamental shift from Universal Analytics. We configure GA4 properties with proper data streams, enhanced measurement events, custom events for your specific conversion actions, and user properties for meaningful segmentation. Data retention settings are configured for GDPR compliance, internal traffic is filtered, and cross-domain tracking is implemented where needed. We also configure Google Signals for cross-device reporting while respecting consent requirements.

Google Tag Manager is the control centre for your measurement stack. We implement a clean, well-documented GTM container with a proper data layer architecture. Every tag fires based on explicit triggers with appropriate consent checks via Consent Mode v2. This includes Google Ads conversion tags, Meta Pixel, LinkedIn Insight Tag, Microsoft Clarity, and any other marketing pixels your campaigns require. The data layer is structured to pass dynamic values like transaction revenue, product IDs, and form submission details to all connected platforms.

Custom dashboards transform raw data into business intelligence. We build Looker Studio dashboards tailored to your KPIs: traffic acquisition by channel and country, conversion funnels from landing to thank-you page, e-commerce revenue attribution, and campaign performance comparisons. Every dashboard is designed for the people who will actually use it, whether that is a marketing manager needing campaign ROI or a CEO wanting monthly growth snapshots. We also configure automated alerts for anomaly detection so you know immediately when something breaks.

marketingAuto.title: MARKETING AUTOMATION
marketingAuto.desc: Automated email workflows, lead scoring, CRM integration, and nurture sequences using Mailchimp, HubSpot, or ActiveCampaign. Turn leads into customers while you sleep.
marketingAuto.longDesc:
Most businesses lose potential customers between first contact and purchase decision because they lack systematic follow-up. Marketing automation closes this gap by delivering the right message to the right person at the right time, automatically. Our service designs and implements automation systems that nurture leads through your sales funnel with personalised, timely communication that feels human even at scale.

We work with the leading automation platforms including Mailchimp, HubSpot, ActiveCampaign, and Brevo (formerly Sendinblue), choosing the best fit based on your business size, budget, and integration requirements. Setup includes CRM integration to ensure your sales team sees every interaction, proper list segmentation based on behaviour and demographics, and custom fields that capture the data points that matter for your business. For European businesses, we ensure all automation complies with GDPR, including proper consent capture, easy unsubscribe mechanisms, and data processing documentation.

Email workflow design is where automation becomes powerful. We build automated sequences for every stage of your customer journey: welcome series for new subscribers, lead nurture sequences that educate and build trust, abandoned cart recovery for e-commerce, post-purchase follow-ups that drive reviews and repeat business, and re-engagement campaigns for inactive contacts. Each workflow includes A/B tested subject lines, personalised content blocks, optimal send time analysis, and clear performance tracking. Multilingual workflows handle French, English, Dutch, and German contacts with content in their preferred language.

Lead scoring quantifies buying intent so your sales team focuses on the hottest prospects. We define scoring models based on engagement signals: email opens, link clicks, page visits, form submissions, and time on site. Scores trigger automated actions like sales notifications, pipeline stage changes, or escalated nurture content. Combined with CRM sync, this creates a closed-loop system where marketing and sales work from the same data, reducing lead response time and increasing conversion rates across your European markets.

geoOpt.title: GEO OPTIMIZATION
geoOpt.desc: Generative Engine Optimization for AI search platforms including ChatGPT, Perplexity, Google AI Overviews, and Copilot. Ensure your brand appears when AI answers your customers' questions.
geoOpt.longDesc:
The search landscape is undergoing its most significant shift since Google replaced directories. AI-powered search platforms like ChatGPT, Perplexity, Google AI Overviews, and Microsoft Copilot are increasingly the first place people go for answers. These systems synthesise information from across the web and present direct answers, often without requiring a click to your website. If your brand is not part of those synthesised answers, you are invisible to a growing segment of your audience. Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) is the discipline of ensuring your brand and content are cited by AI systems.

GEO starts with understanding how large language models source information. AI systems prioritise content that demonstrates clear expertise, provides structured and quotable data points, maintains factual accuracy with citations, and comes from domains with established authority. We audit your content through the lens of AI retrievability: Is your content structured in ways that AI can easily extract and cite? Do your pages contain clear, authoritative statements that AI would choose to reference? Are your entity relationships (brand, products, people) clearly defined across the web?

Our optimisation approach targets the specific signals that AI search platforms weight. We implement comprehensive entity markup using Schema.org vocabulary so AI systems can accurately identify and categorise your business, services, and expertise. We create content specifically designed for AI citation: definitive statistics, expert-attributed insights, structured comparisons, and authoritative how-to content. We optimise your presence on platforms that AI systems heavily reference, including Wikipedia, industry databases, major publications, and structured knowledge sources.

For European businesses, GEO includes multilingual AI visibility. ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Google AI Overviews serve responses in the user's language, drawing from content in that language. We ensure your brand is well-represented in French, English, Dutch, and German AI results. We also monitor your AI search visibility using emerging tools and manual query testing, tracking how often your brand is mentioned, how accurately it is represented, and where competitors are being cited instead. This is a rapidly evolving field, and our strategies adapt as AI search capabilities expand.

faq.technicalSeo1Q: What is the difference between technical SEO and on-page SEO?
faq.technicalSeo1A: Technical SEO focuses on how search engines crawl and index your site: page speed, structured data, XML sitemaps, and Core Web Vitals. On-page SEO covers content optimisation like keywords, headings, and meta tags. Both are essential for rankings.
faq.technicalSeo2Q: How often should a technical SEO audit be performed?
faq.technicalSeo2A: We recommend a comprehensive audit every 6 months, with continuous monitoring in between. Site updates, CMS changes, and Google algorithm updates can introduce new technical issues. Proactive auditing prevents ranking drops before they happen.
faq.technicalSeo3Q: Will technical SEO fixes affect my live website?
faq.technicalSeo3A: All changes are tested in a staging environment first. We provide detailed documentation of every change and deploy during low-traffic hours. Critical fixes like redirects and canonical tags are implemented incrementally with monitoring.
faq.technicalSeo4Q: Do you work with all CMS platforms and tech stacks?
faq.technicalSeo4A: Yes. We audit and optimise sites built on WordPress, Shopify, React, Next.js, and custom platforms. Our recommendations are tailored to your specific tech stack and your development team's capabilities.
faq.localSeo1Q: How long does it take to rank in the local pack?
faq.localSeo1A: Initial improvements appear within 4-8 weeks after Google Business Profile optimisation. Consistent local SEO work over 3-6 months typically achieves stable Local Pack rankings for target keywords in your city.
faq.localSeo2Q: Do I need a physical office to rank locally in a European city?
faq.localSeo2A: A verified physical address helps but is not always required. Service-area businesses can rank without a storefront. We configure your Google Business Profile correctly for your business type, whether you serve customers at your location or theirs.
faq.localSeo3Q: How do you handle local SEO across multiple European countries?
faq.localSeo3A: Each country gets its own localised strategy with market-specific directories, language-appropriate content, and geo-targeted schema markup. We manage separate Google Business Profiles per location and track rankings independently per city.
faq.localSeo4Q: Can you help manage negative reviews on Google?
faq.localSeo4A: We implement review management strategies including professional response templates, flagging policy-violating reviews, and proactive positive review generation campaigns. Reputation management is built into our local SEO service.
faq.intlSeo1Q: Should I use separate domains for each country or subdirectories?
faq.intlSeo1A: For most European businesses, subdirectories (example.com/fr/, example.com/de/) offer the best balance of authority consolidation and geo-targeting. Country-code domains are better only when you have strong existing domain authority per market.
faq.intlSeo2Q: How do you handle keyword research in languages you do not speak natively?
faq.intlSeo2A: We work with native-speaking SEO specialists for each target language. Machine translation misses search intent nuances. Our French, Dutch, and German keyword research reflects actual local search behaviour, not translated English queries.
faq.intlSeo3Q: What is hreflang and why does it matter for my site?
faq.intlSeo3A: Hreflang tells Google which language and country each page targets, preventing the wrong version from ranking in the wrong market. Without it, your French page might rank in the UK, cannibalising your English page's traffic.
faq.intlSeo4Q: Can international SEO work alongside Google Ads for new markets?
faq.intlSeo4A: Absolutely. We often recommend Google Ads for immediate visibility in new markets while international SEO builds organic presence over 3-6 months. The keyword data from ads informs SEO strategy for faster results.
faq.contentSeo1Q: How often should I publish new content for SEO?
faq.contentSeo1A: Quality over frequency. Two thoroughly researched, well-written articles per month outperform daily thin content. We recommend a sustainable cadence that your team can maintain, typically 2-4 pieces monthly for most businesses.
faq.contentSeo2Q: What is a topic cluster and why should I use one?
faq.contentSeo2A: A topic cluster groups related content around a central pillar page. Supporting articles link back to the pillar, building topical authority that Google rewards with higher rankings. It signals deep expertise in your subject area.
faq.contentSeo3Q: Do you write the content or does our team need to produce it?
faq.contentSeo3A: We offer both options. Our team writes SEO-optimised content with expert review, or we provide detailed briefs with keyword targets, outlines, and guidelines for your in-house writers to follow. Either approach delivers results.
faq.contentSeo4Q: How long before content SEO shows measurable results?
faq.contentSeo4A: New content typically begins ranking within 2-4 weeks and reaches stable positions in 2-3 months. Content SEO compounds over time. A well-maintained content library grows more valuable with each published piece and internal link.
faq.linkBuilding1Q: How many backlinks do I need to rank?
faq.linkBuilding1A: There is no fixed number. What matters is link quality, relevance, and velocity relative to competitors. One link from a high-authority European industry publication is worth more than fifty links from random directories.
faq.linkBuilding2Q: Is link building still important after Google's recent updates?
faq.linkBuilding2A: Yes. Google has confirmed that links remain a top ranking signal. The 2024 spam updates penalised low-quality and paid links, but editorial links from relevant, authoritative sites are more valuable than ever for rankings.
faq.linkBuilding3Q: How do you ensure link building is safe and white-hat?
faq.linkBuilding3A: We only pursue editorial links earned through genuine value: newsworthy content, expert commentary, and useful resources. We never buy links, use PBNs, or participate in link schemes. Every link we build would pass a manual Google review.
faq.linkBuilding4Q: Can you build links from European websites specifically?
faq.linkBuilding4A: Yes, European link building is our speciality. We have established relationships with publishers, bloggers, and journalists across the UK, France, Belgium, Netherlands, and Germany. Country-specific links strengthen geo-targeting signals.
faq.seoConsulting1Q: What is included in an SEO consulting engagement?
faq.seoConsulting1A: A comprehensive site audit, prioritised recommendation document, strategy session, and follow-up support. Scope ranges from one-off audits to ongoing monthly advisory retainers depending on your team's needs.
faq.seoConsulting2Q: Can you help with a website migration without losing rankings?
faq.seoConsulting2A: Migration planning is one of our core consulting services. We create comprehensive redirect maps, monitor indexation changes, and provide a pre-launch and post-launch checklist that minimises ranking disruption during the transition.
faq.seoConsulting3Q: Do you offer SEO training for in-house marketing teams?
faq.seoConsulting3A: Yes. We run customised training workshops covering technical SEO, content optimisation, Search Console, and analytics interpretation. Training is adapted to your team's skill level and your specific CMS platform.
faq.seoConsulting4Q: How is SEO consulting different from full-service SEO?
faq.seoConsulting4A: Consulting provides strategy and guidance while your team handles execution. Full-service SEO includes implementation. Consulting is ideal for teams with technical capability who need expert direction and accountability.
faq.googleAds1Q: What is the minimum monthly budget you recommend for Google Ads?
faq.googleAds1A: We recommend a minimum of 500 euros per month per market for meaningful data and optimisation. Smaller budgets struggle to generate enough conversions for automated bidding strategies to learn effectively.
faq.googleAds2Q: How do you handle multilingual Google Ads campaigns?
faq.googleAds2A: Each language market gets its own campaign with native-level ad copy, market-specific keywords, and tailored landing pages. We never simply translate ads. Cultural nuances, local trust signals, and regional CTAs differ significantly.
faq.googleAds3Q: How quickly will I see results from Google Ads?
faq.googleAds3A: Traffic starts immediately once campaigns are live. The optimisation learning phase typically takes 2-4 weeks as Google's algorithms gather conversion data. Meaningful CPA improvements are usually visible within the first month.
faq.googleAds4Q: Do you manage the ad spend budget or does the client?
faq.googleAds4A: Ad spend goes directly through your Google Ads account so you maintain full control and transparency. Our management fee covers strategy, setup, optimisation, and reporting. You see exactly where every euro is spent.
faq.analyticsSetup1Q: Why should I upgrade to GA4 if my tracking seems to work?
faq.analyticsSetup1A: Universal Analytics stopped processing data in July 2024. GA4 offers event-based tracking, cross-platform measurement, and machine learning insights. Proper GA4 setup also ensures compliance with EU Consent Mode v2 requirements.
faq.analyticsSetup2Q: What is Consent Mode v2 and do I need it?
faq.analyticsSetup2A: Consent Mode v2 is required for Google Ads in the EU since March 2024. It sends consent signals to Google, enabling modelled conversions even when users decline cookies. Without it, you lose conversion data and campaign optimisation capability.
faq.analyticsSetup3Q: Can you set up tracking without slowing down my website?
faq.analyticsSetup3A: Yes. We use Google Tag Manager with asynchronous loading, and we implement server-side tagging where appropriate to minimise client-side JavaScript. Consent Mode ensures tags only fire after user consent, further reducing initial page load impact.
faq.analyticsSetup4Q: Do you provide training on how to use the dashboards?
faq.analyticsSetup4A: Every analytics setup includes a training session covering dashboard navigation, key metrics interpretation, and how to extract actionable insights. We also provide written documentation your team can reference independently.
faq.marketingAuto1Q: Which marketing automation platform do you recommend?
faq.marketingAuto1A: It depends on your needs and budget. Mailchimp suits small businesses and e-commerce. HubSpot is ideal for B2B with complex sales cycles. ActiveCampaign offers the best automation features for its price. We help you choose the right fit.
faq.marketingAuto2Q: How do you ensure automated emails comply with GDPR?
faq.marketingAuto2A: Every automation includes proper consent capture, easy unsubscribe in every email, data processing documentation, and retention policies. We configure double opt-in for European contacts and maintain suppression lists across all platforms.
faq.marketingAuto3Q: What kind of ROI can I expect from marketing automation?
faq.marketingAuto3A: Clients typically see 15-25% increases in lead-to-customer conversion rates within the first quarter. Automated nurture sequences recover leads that would otherwise go cold, and cart abandonment emails alone can recover 10-15% of lost revenue.
faq.marketingAuto4Q: Can automation work with my existing CRM system?
faq.marketingAuto4A: Yes. We integrate with Salesforce, HubSpot CRM, Pipedrive, and most modern CRM platforms via native integrations or Zapier. Bi-directional sync ensures your sales team sees every marketing touchpoint in their existing workflow.
faq.geoOpt1Q: What is the difference between GEO and traditional SEO?
faq.geoOpt1A: Traditional SEO optimises for search engine result pages. GEO optimises for AI-generated answers in platforms like ChatGPT and Perplexity. Both are important, but GEO specifically targets how AI systems cite and recommend your brand.
faq.geoOpt2Q: Can I track whether AI platforms are mentioning my brand?
faq.geoOpt2A: Yes. We use a combination of manual query testing across AI platforms and emerging monitoring tools to track brand mentions, accuracy, and sentiment in AI-generated responses. Monthly reports show visibility trends.
faq.geoOpt3Q: Is GEO relevant for small European businesses or only large brands?
faq.geoOpt3A: GEO is relevant for any business whose customers use AI search. Local service businesses benefit when ChatGPT or Google AI Overviews recommend providers. Early adoption creates a competitive advantage as AI search usage grows rapidly.
faq.geoOpt4Q: How quickly does GEO optimisation show results?
faq.geoOpt4A: AI systems update their knowledge bases at different rates. Google AI Overviews reflect changes within weeks. ChatGPT and Perplexity may take 1-3 months to surface new citations. Early and consistent effort compounds into strong AI visibility.
